TopicTitle: All these worlds are yours except Europa. Attempt no landings there?

Articles.Content:
I watched both Space Odyssey movies, i just wonder why Mankind are forbidden from Europa Moon?

What it's the meaning of that prohibition?

SPOILER ALERT

Basically because Jupiter is now a sun it begins to heat up Europa, this allows the life on Europa evolve. The warning is to prevent mankind from interfering with said life, in a basic sense.

I watched both Space Odyssey movies, i just wonder why Mankind are forbidden from Europa Moon?

What it's the meaning of that prohibition?

Because the Obelisk has kindled the fire of directed evolution there?

Edited September 19, 2014 by Godot

I watched both Space Odyssey movies, i just wonder why Mankind are forbidden from Europa Moon?

What it's the meaning of that prohibition?

To make you think about it.

Because the Obelisk has kindled the fire of directed evolution there?

BINGO!

Read the third novel in the series, Clarke actually developed the plot regarding that.

BINGO!

Read the third novel in the series, Clarke actually developed the plot regarding that.

Maybe i read all books i only watched movies, the Kubrick masterpiece and second movie, i know that both was based on books, but i never read.

I thought it was because we didn't pay the rent and got evicted.

Ok, mebe it was the evolution thing. Or possible Kraken attack if you try and land there.
I interpreted it as meaning "Leave the life the Monolith sparked here alone to develop naturally. Do your exploring elsewhere."

Yeah, except I always gathered that the life wasn't so much started by the monolith so much as it always existed there in some capacity. When Jupiter was ignited, it was going to proliferate, and didn't need dirty humans to come muck it up with all their terrestrial bacteria and ideas of conquest.

See also earlier in the same book when the Chinese ship landed there to refuel and got eaten by a light-loving monster from under the ice.

I don't read the book but form Wikipedia i know that in subsequent books, Monolith deemed that mankind deemed us to aggressive and want destroy us but in the end the We mankind finished ......., not other way around, so we are smarter ;-)

Yeah, except I always gathered that the life wasn't so much started by the monolith so much as it always existed there in some capacity. When Jupiter was ignited, it was going to proliferate, and didn't need dirty humans to come muck it up with all their terrestrial bacteria and ideas of conquest.

See also earlier in the same book when the Chinese ship landed there to refuel and got eaten by a light-loving monster from under the ice.

I'm not spoilering any more, makes the thread hard to read.

I didn't mean "started" by sparked, just rapidly advanced because of Monolith contact. Just as the protohumans were sparked to develop tool usage in 2001.
